cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi-Alabama border (central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Shell Beach to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Okaloosa-Walton County Line westward to east of Morgan City, LA, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Tuesday into early Wednesday; brief gusts near hurricane strength cannot be ruled out if Gordon strengthens prior to landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 feet of surge possible along the Plaquemines Parish coast and lower Mississippi River delta, especially east of the river mouth.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches; risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous marine/river currents likely during closest approach.
